Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES THE STUDENT WITH THE CONCEPTS, PRINCIPLES, METHODS AND TECHNIQUES OF COST ACCOUNTING THAT ALLOW HIM/HER TO MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS AND ANALYZE THE ACCOUNTING DYNAMICS OF A COMPANY IN TERMS OF THE MANUFACTURING OF GOODS FOR SALE. IN ADDITION, THE COURSE PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH AN UNDERSTANDING OF COST ACCOUNTING AND ITS APPLICATION IN ANY TYPE OF BUSINESS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
IDENTIFY THE PRINCIPLES, OBJECTIVES AND IMPORTANCE OF COST ACCOUNTING.
DIFFERENTIATE COSTS FROM EXPENSES.
ANALYZE THE COMPONENTS OF A COST IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE UNIT COST OF A PRODUCT.
IDENTIFY THE IMPORTANCE OF DEPARTMENTALIZATION FOR AN APPROPRIATE ALLOCATION OF COSTS.
STATE THE VARIOUS TYPES OF INDUSTRIES THAT EXIST AND EXPLAIN THE CLASSIFICATION OF COST SYSTEMS.
DIFFERENTIATE REAL COSTS, ESTIMATED COSTS AND STANDARD COSTS.
IDENTIFY THE DIFFERENT SYSTEMS USED TO DETERMINE THE UNIT COST OF A PRODUCT.
ANALYZE, IN DETAIL, EACH COMPONENT OF THE COST: DIRECT LABOR, DIRECT MATERIALS AND INDIRECT MANUFACTURING COSTS. (MANUFACTURING OVERHEAD)
DESCRIBE THE MOST COMMON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ACCORDING TO GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, EXPLAINING THEIR INTERRELATIONSHIP.
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING
AUTHOR: WARREN, CARL S. / REEVE, JAMES M. / DUCHAC, JONATHAN
